short.am,ar,bg,bn,ca,cs,da,de,el,en,en_AU,en_G: Save content from the web to Logseq, in a private and durable format you can access offline.

long.ar,de,hi,id,it,ko,nl,pl,pt_BR,tr,zh_CN,z:
A fork of the official Obsidian Web Clipper, adapted for Logseq. Save content from the web directly to your Logseq graph for offline access.
This extension helps you capture online content seamlessly into Logseq.

- Clip anything: Save any web page to Logseq
- Select page content: Decide whether you want to save entire websites, main content, or your highlights
- Customizable templates: Create templates to have control over which metadata is extracted
- Smart triggers: Create rules to decide which template is used on which website
- Seamless integration: Send your clips directly to Logseq either to the daily page, as a new page, or at the cursor position

The Web Clipper is designed to protect your privacy and give you control over your data.

- File format: All clips are stored in widely-used Markdown files
- Offline access: Your saved clips are stored locally
- 100% private: All your clipped content is stored locally in your Logseq graph

Download Logseq:
https://logseq.com

Logseq Web Clipper is open source:
https://github.com/j3sch/logseq-clipper

License Information:
This extension is a fork of the Obsidian Web Clipper by Obsidian
Licensed under the MIT License
Original Project:
- Chrome Web Store: https://chromewebstore.google.com/detail/obsidian-web-clipper/cnjifjpddelmedmihgijeibhnjfabmlf
- GitHub: https://github.com/obsidianmd/obsidian-clipper

Copyright (c) 2024 Jens Schlegel
long.am,bg,bn,ca,cs,da,el,en,en_AU,en_GB,en_U:
An unofficial Chrome Extension for Logseq that enables you to capture web content directly into your Logseq graph, based on the official Obsidian Web Clipper extension.

Key Features:
• Clip Pages Your Way: Save entire web pages or just the text passages you highlight
• Select Destination: Send clips to your daily notes, a new page, or at your cursor position
• Privacy First: Everything is stored locally in Markdown files for offline access

This extension is a fork of the Obsidian Web Clipper. I'd like to express my gratitude to the Obsidian team for their excellent work that made this adaptation possible.

Logseq Web Clipper is open source:
https://github.com/j3sch/logseq-clipper

License Information:
This extension is a fork of the Obsidian Web Clipper by Obsidian
Licensed under the MIT License
Original Project:
- Chrome Web Store: https://chromewebstore.google.com/detail/obsidian-web-clipper/cnjifjpddelmedmihgijeibhnjfabmlf
- GitHub: https://github.com/obsidianmd/obsidian-clipper

Copyright (c) 2024 Jens Schlegel
long.es,fa,fr,ja,ru:
A fork of the official Obsidian Web Clipper, adapted for Logseq. Save content from the web directly to your Logseq graph for offline access.
This extension helps you capture online content seamlessly into Logseq, so your notes are always available, even without an internet connection.

- Clip anything: Save any web page to Logseq
- Select page content: Decide whether you want to save entire websites, main content or your highlights.
- Customizable templates: Create templates to have control over which metadata is extracted.
- Smart triggers: Create rules to decide which template is used on which website.
- Seamless integration: Send your clips directly to logsec either to the daily page, as a new page or at the cursor position.

The Web Clipper is designed to protect your privacy, and give you control over your data.
- File format: All clips are stored in the widely-used Markdown files.
- Offline access: your saved clips are saved locally.
- 100% private: all your clipped content is stored locally in your Logseq graph. 

Download Logseq:
https://logseq.com

Logseq Web Clipper is open source. You can help us improve it by submitting bugs and fixes on GitHub:
https://github.com/j3sch/logseq-clipper

Official Obsidian Web Clipper:
https://chromewebstore.google.com/detail/obsidian-web-clipper/cnjifjpddelmedmihgijeibhnjfabmlf
